# Do I need this?

## How it started

::: {.columns .v-center-container}
::: {.column width="60%"}

- Began to address reproducible issues in research while I was working in academia

- Goal was to build a package to summarize study results with code that was [both simple and customizable]{.emphasis}

- First release in May 2019

  - [1,000,000+ installations]{.emphasis} from CRAN
  - 1000+ GitHub stars
  - 300+ contributors 
  - ~50 code contributors

:::

## {gtsummary} overview

::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="50%"}
-   Create [tabular summaries]{.emphasis} with sensible defaults but highly customizable
-   Types of summaries:
    -   Demographic- or "Table 1"-types
    -   Cross-tabulation
    -   Regression models
    -   Survival data
    -   Survey data
    -   Custom tables
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
-   Report statistics from {gtsummary} tables [inline]{.emphasis} in R Markdown
-   Stack and/or merge any table type
-   Use [themes]{.emphasis} to standardize across tables
-   Choose from different [print engines]{.emphasis}
:::
:::


## {gtsummary} overview

For our workshop, we will focus on the following summary types as well as [themes]{.emphasis} and  [print engines]{.emphasis}.

- `tbl_summary()`

- `tbl_cross()`

- `tbl_continuous()`

- `tbl_wide_summary()`
